# How to Make iOS Apps Work with Per App VPN

Last updated January 28, 2026 by Appdome

Learn how to make iOS apps work with Per App VPN in minutes – no code or coding required. Secure mobile data in transit fast and easy. Per App VPN Routing is a feature supplied by Apple’s iOS to tunnel connections through a VPN.

The only way to configure Per-App VPN is by enrolling the device in a Mobile Device Management (MDM) system and linking apps that are managed by the MDM system with a VPN configuration. The app’s traffic will then be handled by Apple’s VPN component.

## How to Make iOS Apps Work with Per App VPN

To enable this feature in your mobile app using Appdome:

1. Go to the Build Tab
2. Select the Access menu
3. Turn on Per-App VPN Routing

![Per App VPN routing switch](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/PerAppVPNRouting.png)

4. You will see a warning message that other features are being disabled. Click Proceed.

![Per App VPN routing warning](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/PerAppVPNRouting_2.png)

### Per App VPN Routing Compatibility

To allow this feature to handle the traffic, the following Appdome features will be turned off automatically, or an error will be displayed

* [Mobile Access and MicroVPN Profiles](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/byod-zero-trust/cyber-security-compliance/use-in-app-micro-vpn-remote-access-mobile-apps/)
* [Any non-NTLM Authentication Profiles](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/byod-zero-trust/no-code-mobile-sso/use-enterprise-authentication-mobile-apps/)
* [Identity services](https://www.appdome.com/knowledgebase-category/mobile-identity/)
* [IP Address Visibility](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/appdomes-comprehensive-mobile-security-suite/)
* [URL Whitelisting](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/man-in-the-middle-attack-prevention/connect-to-trusted-mobile-hosts-with-url-whitelisting/)
* [Proxy Settings](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/byod-zero-trust/cyber-security-compliance/add-proxy-pac-routing-enterprise-mobile-apps/)

Even if you tunnel an app’s entire network connectivity, you are still able to secure your app by using complementary Appdome features such as:

1. [Enforce Strong RSA Signature](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-apps/no-code-man-in-the-middle-prevention/secure-mobile-app-sessions-ssl-certificate-hardening/)
2. [Enforce Strong ECC Signature](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-apps/no-code-man-in-the-middle-prevention/secure-mobile-app-sessions-ssl-certificate-hardening/)
3. [Enforce SHA256 Digest](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-apps/no-code-man-in-the-middle-prevention/secure-mobile-app-sessions-ssl-certificate-hardening/)
4. [Enforce Certificate Roles](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-apps/no-code-man-in-the-middle-prevention/secure-mobile-app-sessions-ssl-certificate-hardening/)
5. [Validating Basic Constraints for CA certificates](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/trusted-session-inspection/)
6. [Static Client Pinning](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/byod-zero-trust/cyber-security-compliance/use-in-app-micro-vpn-remote-access-mobile-apps/) and [Certificate Pinning](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/securing-workplace-apps/enterprise-mobile-app-security/use-certificate-pinning-in-enterprise-mobile-apps/)
7. [Authentication using NTLM](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/byod-zero-trust/no-code-mobile-sso/use-enterprise-authentication-mobile-apps/) or: Basic authentication, Digest, Ngotiate or an HTML form.
